website_summaries.verdict: The EF 180mm Macro f/3.5L is a sharp telephoto macro lens for Canon D-SLRs. It supports 1:1 magnification, but lacks image stabilization.

customer_reviews.title: Great Canon Macro lens
customer_reviews.text: What is there to say about this lens that hasn't been said before. It is a fantastic macro lens if you are a canon shooter. It can hunt for focus a bit at close range on non-contrasty subjects, but is very sharp and a fun lens to shoot with.
customer_reviews.author: The Creative Fellow

customer_reviews.title: Canon L Glass Near Excellent
customer_reviews.text: For macro this is incredible, with a couple of caveats... No IS so handheld is near impossible for macro, and you really need to manual focus for macro as the autofocus just isn't accurate or hunts a bit too much. When you're in focus on a tripod though, the bokeh is "unfreakinbelievable"! (new word).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens Great service
customer_reviews.text: The Canon 180mm Macro is excellent. It performs well and is a solidly built lens and the results are amazing. It is everything that I have read and performs as advertised. The benefit of this Macro is you can be 1/2 a meter from the subject - which keeps you from frightening any critters you are photographing and gives distance between the lens and subject without shadowing. In addition the people I purchased this lens from were excellent and the condition of the lens was everything they said. I have been pleasantly surprise with the whole purchase experience.
customer_reviews.author: Dai Luo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens. I've used it to capture pollen in tiny wildflowers! I would, however, recommend also getting a macro flash of some sort - f32 really limits your light. If you don't have a flash you either need a still subject and a tripod, or full sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H.

customer_reviews.title: Extreme sharp, but too heavy
customer_reviews.text: Extreme good quality and super sharp photos. Only three stars because its extremely heavy and almost unusable for handheld due to no image stabilization
customer_reviews.author: Ivo G.

customer_reviews.title: It is super sharp, just the focusing is slow
customer_reviews.text: I had the Canon 100mm F2.8, traded up to the F2.8L and returned as well then and got this 180mm instead. The 100mm on full frame still meant I had to be so close to the subject be it flowers which meant often I was casting a shadow, or I was scarying away a bug. It is super sharp, just the focusing is slow, however for macro I only use manual focus anyway. It is also amazing at close up portraits for eye lashes, sharp hair strands, dimples, bokeh is great too. Most of the time I am at F8 and more closed anyway so F3.5 is no loss due to DOF at this range.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Person

customer_reviews.title: Tack Sharp, Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: Tack sharp lens, love this thing and I just started using it this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: 180 mm  macro lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens, perfect picture every time, have to stand a bit back to get a good shot though, wonderful clairity where focused and great blur in background, adds real depth to the pictures - this is the only macro lens you will ever need!!
customer_reviews.author: thearchitect

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is worth every penny especially with Amazon,s price. Takes awesome close ups better then my Canon 100mm macro lens. I will hang on to my 100mm for now because that lens also takes some great pohtos. The Canon 180mm gets you closer to your subject.
customer_reviews.author: BLUFOX51

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my first macro lens. I love it. I was using a 250mm with extension and a Canon 500D filter to get close. This makes everything faster and easier and I can shoot from a distance.
customer_reviews.author: trote

customer_reviews.title: amazing lens
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing lens... I was questioning buying it but I needed the macro to get up on peoples faces. Its not the quickest focus mechanism but damn are the shots clear!
customer_reviews.author: D. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens! I can get fairly good close up photos with this lens but the auto-focus is a bit on the slow side, so I carefully help it along.
customer_reviews.author: David Good

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Sharp
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Sharp. Have the Canon 7D and with the crop factor this is like a 300 mm Macro.
customer_reviews.author: DLS

customer_reviews.title: Amazing photo quality!
customer_reviews.text: Having a hard time focusing on subject, the lens goes back and forth like crazy. Manual autofocus recommended. Wish it had stabilizer. Amazing quality photo. I can't be more happy with it. Recommended if you love macro photography!
customer_reviews.author: Ceci Fernández

customer_reviews.title: Really good lense!
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well made, Really good quality. Takes very good quality pictures. Need a good camera to go in pair with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha Fan

customer_reviews.title: rapport prix/$$$ excellent, je recommande ce produit
customer_reviews.text: Très bonne qualité, rapport prix/$$$ excellent, je recommande ce produit.....!!!
customer_reviews.author: Al;ain Forget

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time and packaged well. The lense has ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and packaged well. The lense has had little testing so far but seems to be living up to its legendary status.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and I'm certain they are loving it!
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: and in excellent condition, very happy with the product
customer_reviews.text: in line with expectations and offered , arrived at the date indicated , and in excellent condition , very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Julian F. Marmolejo

customer_reviews.title: great lens
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this lens and the whole shopping experience I had purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Istvan S. Torok

customer_reviews.title: Overcame my fear of large online purchases!
customer_reviews.text: My transaction was quick and informative. I'm now more prone to make purchases through Amazon if not any other site.
customer_reviews.author: T186kmps

customer_reviews.title: Uh mazing
customer_reviews.text: Hot dang! So crazy the difference in quality! I’m a dentist and use it for dental patients. I have to get like 10 feet away to get their whole face in the picture but they look amazing!
customer_reviews.author: R. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens with outstanding image quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens from my local dealer and am blown away with the IQ it produces. I am using it both as a macro and also as an outdoor portrait lens. The sharpness, saturation, color accuracy and contrast are matched only by the best optics I've ever seen. For the money, this lens is a bargain. Take a look at what other top notch glass costs.
customer_reviews.author: Dutton and Beth Armstrong, Editors

customer_reviews.title: The best macro lens
customer_reviews.text: The best macro lens. Its macro lens but I use it for portraits specially kids pix are super with this lens. I used the extention tube/adapter and took Red Moon puctures on a cloudy night from my balcony and they came out great. When I bought I was using only for flower photography then started using it for portraits, love it. The only problem is its heavy and slow focusing. When Itake portraits I go far away to cover the person. I don't take full length with this any way only head shots
customer_reviews.author: Jt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens
customer_reviews.text: I have taken some amazing photos using this lens. Since it is 180mm you don't need to be as close to the subject, which helps greatly with bugs. The only downside to the len is that it is extremely heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene

customer_reviews.title: Create ART with this lens !!
customer_reviews.text: Good and sharp ... look up ArtofJCW to see more shots with this lens
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Worth it's weight
customer_reviews.text: Regarding the suggestion that one instead get a 70-200 and extension tubes... yes, that would be more versatile than the macro alone, but I have a 70-200 and extension tubes, and they can't compare to the 180 macro.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Canon telephoto 180 L series lens
customer_reviews.text: It is great--exactly what I expected from the Canon L series. I used it on a recent trip to the Missouri River (Lewis & Clark) area and was extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Wells

product_meta.title: Canon EF 180mm f3.5L Macro USM AutoFocus Telephoto Lens for Canon SLR Cameras
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Bring small things into full-sized view with the Canon EF 180mm macro USM lens. Macro lenses can uncover detail that would be impossible to detect by the eye and give new perspective to extremely minute subjects such as insects or the petals of a small flower, and this lens is no exception. The 180mm lens offers such features as three UD glass elements and an internal floating system, which combine to minimize aberrations caused by changes in the focusing distance; an advanced ultra-sonic monitor (USM) for high-speed, quiet autofocusing; full-time mechanical manual focusing; and a focusing distance range of 1.57 feet to infinity. Compatible with the EF Extender 1.4x and 2x, the lens carries a one-year warranty. 

 

 * Focal length: 180mm 
 * Maximum aperture: 1:3.5 
 * Lens construction: 14 elements in 12 groups 
 * Diagonal angle of view: 13 degrees (at 30 feet) 
 * Focus adjustment: Inner focusing system with USM 
 * Closest focusing distance: 1.6 feet 
 * Filter size: 72mm 
 * Dimensions: 3.2 inches in diameter, 7.3 inches long 
 * Weight: 2.4 pounds
feature_bullets: 180mm macro lens with f/3.5 maximum aperture for Canon SLR cameras
3 UD glass elements and internal floating system combine to minimize aberrations
Advanced ultra-sonic monitor (USM) for high-speed, quiet autofocusing
Focusing distance range of 1.57 feet to infinity; supports EF Extender 1.4x and 2x
Measures 3.2 inches in diameter and 7.3 inches long; weighs 2.4 pounds; 1-year warranty
